alert.note: Alert for Des Moines; Henry; Lee (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 20 at 2:01PM CDT until April 20 at 2:45PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN HENRY...DES MOINES AND NORTH CENTRAL LEE COUNTIES... At 201 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Lowell, or 10 miles southeast of Mount Pleasant, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... New London around 205 PM CDT. Danville and Middletown around 210 PM CDT. West Burlington, Big Hollow Recreation Area, Prairie Grove, Pleasant Grove and Beaverdale around 215 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Dodgeville, Sperry, Starr`s Cave Park and Preserve, Mediapolis, Kossuth, Kingston, Northfield, Oquawka and 4th Pumping Station Campground. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
